question: Angle of the Neck Of Femur to shaft is:
exp: The Angle formed by axis of Femoral Shaft and Line drawn along axis of Femoral Neck is about 127deg (125-140deg).

question: Which of the following is a component of deltoid ligament
exp: Deltoid ligament has 4 components (all with prefix 'Tibia'): * Anterior tibiotalar ligament * Posterior tibiotalar ligament * Tibio-calcaneal pa* Tibio-navicular ligament - attaching to navicular bone at medial side of the foot. - Spring ligament / calcaneo-navicular ligament which connects navicular bone's plantar surface with sustentaculum of calcaneus is not a component of deltoid ligament fig:-Deltoid ligament of ankle

question: Iliofemoral Ligament arise from:
exp: Ilio. Femoral Ligament (of Biglow) is Y shaped, arising from the Anterior Inferior Iliac Spine and the rim of the acetabulum, it spreads obliquely downwards and lateral to attach to the Interochanteric line on the Anterior side of the Femoral Head.

question: ACL prevents:
exp: Anterior cruciate ligament (ACL) prevents posterior displacement of femur(PDF) on tibia and the anterior displacement of tibia on femur, as well. Posterior cruciate ligament- prevent anterior displacement of femur on tibia and the posterior displacement of tibia on femur, as well.

question: Most Anterior Structure on Tibial Plateau:
exp: Anterior Horn of Medial Meniscus is the most anterior structure attached on the Intercondylar Area on the Superior Surface of Tibia. fig:- structure attached on the Intercondylar Area of Tibia. mnemonicfor remembering ligaments anterior to posterior-"Medical College Lucknow, Lucknow Medical College"

question: Which of the following structures is most significant in resisting hyperextension of the hip joint?,
exp: The Iliofemoral Ligament resist both hyperextension and lateral rotation at the hip joint. The Pubofemoral ligament reinforces the joint inferiorly and limits extension and abduction. The Ischiofemoral ligament reinforces the joint posteriorly and limits extension and medial rotation. The Gluteus Maximus muscle extends and laterally rotates the thigh and does not paicularly resist hyperextension
